server/controller

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the Authorization header.

Source:
  • server/controller/professionalClientProfile.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

(async, inner) createIssue(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Creates a new issue based on the provided request data.

Source:
  • server/controller/createIssue.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
body Object

The body of the request.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
title string

The title of the issue.
description string

The description of the issue.
professionalNeeded string

The type of professional needed for the issue.
email string

The email of the user creating the issue.
status string <optional>
 'open'

The status of the issue (default is 'open').
file Object

The file object containing the uploaded image (optional).
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if the issue creation fails.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a promise that resolves to void.
Type
Promise.<void>

(async, inner) forgotPassword(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Handles the forgot password functionality.

    This function finds a user by their email address, generates a password reset PIN, stores the PIN and its expiration time in the database, and sends an email with the PIN to the user.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 52
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
body Object

The body of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
email string

The email address of the user requesting a password reset.
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if the user is not found, or if there is a failure in updating the user or sending the email.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the function completes.
Type
Promise.<void>

(inner) generatePin() → {string}

Description:

  • Generates a 6-digit PIN.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 33
Returns:

A randomly generated 6-digit PIN.

Type
string

(async, inner) getAllIssues(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Controller function to get all issues.

    This function fetches all jobs, formats them using the issueDTO function, and sends the formatted jobs in the response.

Source:
  • server/controller/getAllIssues.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • If there is an error fetching the jobs, a 500 status code is sent with an error message.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the response is sent.
Type
Promise.<void>

(async, inner) getCoordinates(fullAddress) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Fetches the geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude) for a given address using the Google Geocoding API.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientVerifyAddress.js, line 63
Parameters:
Name Type Description
fullAddress string

The full address to geocode.
Throws:

Will log an error message if the Geocoding API request fails.

Returns:

A promise that resolves when the coordinates have been fetched and stored.

Type
Promise.<void>

(async, inner) getMyProfessionalJobs(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • This function fetches all quotes associated with the professional's email, categorizes them by status (all, done, pending, active), calculates the total amount earned, and sends the categorized jobs and amount earned as a JSON response.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 61
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user Object

The user object from the JWT.

Properties
Name Type Description
email string

The email of the professional.
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • If an error occurs while fetching the jobs, a 500 status code and an error message are sent.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves to void.
Type
Promise.<void>

(async, inner) updateJob(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Updates a job with the given jobId using the provided data.

Source:
  • server/controller/myIssuesPosted.js, line 113
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
params Object

The request parameters.

Properties
Name Type Description
jobId string

The ID of the job to update.
body Object

The request body containing the job data.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
title string <optional>

The new title of the job.
description string <optional>

The new description of the job.
professionalNeeded string <optional>

The new professional needed for the job.
status string <optional>

The new status of the job.
imageUrl string <optional>

The existing image URL of the job.
file Object <optional>

The uploaded file object.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
path string <optional>

The path of the uploaded image file.
res Object

The response object.
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the job is updated.
Type
Promise.<void>

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Returns:

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21

Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

res Object

Express response object.

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

Type

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the Authorization header.

Source:
  • server/controller/professionalClientProfile.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

res Object

next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.

(async, inner) getMyProfessionalJobs(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • This function fetches all quotes associated with the professional's email, categorizes them by status (all, done, pending, active), calculates the total amount earned, and sends the categorized jobs and amount earned as a JSON response.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 61
Parameters:
Name Type Description

Name Type Description

Name Type Description

The response object.
Throws:
  • If an error occurs while fetching the jobs, a 500 status code and an error message are sent.

Error
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves to void.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Properties
Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description

res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:

Name Type Description

The request body containing the job data.

Name Type Attributes Description

The new title of the job.

The new professional needed for the job.

The new status of the job.

Name Type Attributes Description

The path of the uploaded image file.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

res Object

Returns:

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

  • Handles the forgot password functionality.

    This function finds a user by their email address, generates a password reset PIN, stores the PIN and its expiration time in the database, and sends an email with the PIN to the user.

Name Type Description

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description

The response object.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if the user is not found, or if there is a failure in updating the user or sending the email.

Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the function completes.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Properties
Name Type Description

Name Type Description

res Object

next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.

Name Type Description

Name Type Description

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description

The request parameters.

Properties
Name Type Description

The ID of the job to update.
body Object

The request body containing the job data.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
title string <optional>

The new title of the job.
description string <optional>

The new description of the job.
professionalNeeded string <optional>

The new professional needed for the job.
status string <optional>

The new status of the job.
imageUrl string <optional>

The existing image URL of the job.
file Object <optional>

The uploaded file object.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
path string <optional>

The path of the uploaded image file.
res Object

The response object.
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the job is updated.

Promise.<void>

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

res Object

Express next middleware function.
Returns:

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

  • server/controller/createIssue.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
body Object

The body of the request.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
title string

The title of the issue.
description string

The description of the issue.
professionalNeeded string

The type of professional needed for the issue.
email string

The email of the user creating the issue.
status string <optional>
 'open'

The status of the issue (default is 'open').
file Object

The file object containing the uploaded image (optional).
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if the issue creation fails.

Error
Returns:
  • Returns a promise that resolves to void.

(async, inner) forgotPassword(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Description:

  • Handles the forgot password functionality.

    This function finds a user by their email address, generates a password reset PIN, stores the PIN and its expiration time in the database, and sends an email with the PIN to the user.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 52
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
body Object

The body of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
email string

The email address of the user requesting a password reset.
res Object

The response object.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if the user is not found, or if there is a failure in updating the user or sending the email.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • A promise that resolves when the function completes.
Type

Name Type Description

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description

The request parameters.

Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description

description string <optional>

The new description of the job.
professionalNeeded string <optional>

The new professional needed for the job.

The new status of the job.

The existing image URL of the job.

The uploaded file object.

Name Type Attributes Description
path string <optional>

The path of the uploaded image file.
res Object

The response object.

  • A promise that resolves when the job is updated.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Properties
Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description

res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.

The status of the issue (default is 'open').

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

The next middleware function.

  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

Type

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/submitQuote.js, line 27
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

Returns:

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

(async, inner) getNotificationHistory(req, res) → {Promise.<void>}

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

res Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization Object

res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
Type
Object

Members

(inner, constant) transporter :Object

Description:

  • Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Source:
  • server/controller/resetController.js, line 10
Properties:
Name Type Description
service string

The email service to use (Gmail).
auth Object

The authentication object.

Properties
Name Type Description
user string

The email address to use for sending emails.
pass string

The password for the email account, retrieved from environment variables.

Creates a transporter object using the default SMTP transport. This transporter is configured to use Gmail service with authentication.

Type:
  • Object

Methods

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT tokens.

    This middleware checks for the presence of an authorization header, verifies the JWT token, and attaches the user data to the request object.

Source:
  • server/controller/authenticate.js, line 28
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

The request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

The headers of the request.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

The authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

The response object.
next function

The next middleware function.
Throws:
  • Throws an error if there is an issue with the authentication process.
Type
Error
Returns:
  • Returns a response with status 401 if the authorization header or token is missing, status 403 if the token verification fails, status 404 if the user is not found, or status 500 if there is a server error.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/fixerClientProfile.js, line 21
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.

Properties
Name Type Description
headers Object

Request headers.

Properties
Name Type Description
authorization string

Authorization header containing the JWT token.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if no token is provided or if the token is invalid. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware or route handler if the token is valid.
Type
Object

(inner) authenticateJWT(req, res, next) → {Object}

Description:

  • Middleware to authenticate JWT token from the request headers.

Source:
  • server/controller/getMyProfessionalJobs.js, line 19
Parameters:
Name Type Description
req Object

Express request object.
res Object

Express response object.
next function

Express next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with 'Unauthorized' message if no token is provided. Returns a 403 status with 'Forbidden' message if token verification fails. Proceeds to the next middleware if token is valid.
Type
Object

res Object

next function

The next middleware function.
Returns:
  • Returns a 401 status with a message 'Unauthorized' if the authorization header or token is missing. Returns a 403 status with a message 'Forbidden' if the token verification fails. Calls the next middleware function if the token is successfully verified.
